Blog.post: i changed my blogspot address...my original reason was i don't want him to be updated with my activities anymore. coz its like, he's there watching me from a distance and im inside a glass or something. seesh!and what i hated most is that it is quite obvious that he doesn't want to communicate with me. like i emailed him and asked how he was...he would just reply that he's ok and was sorry he wasn't calling or writing.i even called him...last week of may. we talked for a maximum of 4 or 5 minutes only. i felt excited to talk to him but at his end...i dunno! i kinda confirmed that he IS deliberately avoiding me. i read his blog for last week and he wrote it there. not communicating so that "things won't get complicated". i rest my case. it saddens me...but im still hoping. i'll just pray for him and for everything that is happening right now to both of us.

Guys tell: What matters most By Matthew Sakey For all their similarities, guys also display great variance. As satisfying as it would be to cynically insist that every man on earth is interested only in willingness to copulate, bust size, leg length and sympathy to scheduling issues during football season (in that order), it's not a fair judgment. Many qualities guys look for are intangible, so if you're in the market, be advised that most men value these features above all others. 1. Tolerance This is often interpreted as "sympathy to scheduling issues during football season," but it's really much broader than that. Guys like what they like â€” whatever that may be, and it will certainly differ from guy to guy â€” and though they might make an effort to respect your feelings about their pastimes and viewpoints, they're not likely to change them for you. Guys want to be with women who don't roll their eyes when they head out to play D&D or insist that a visit to the shoe store is more important than hockey playoffs. Respect their idiosyncrasies and they'll respect yours. 2. Compatibility with friends His friends aren't necessarily going to become your friends, but you need to be able to stand their presence. In fact, it would help if you like them a little, always remembering that they are his friends, so a certain boundary needs to be respected. There will be times when he wants to be with them rather than you, and if you like them it'll help clarify why. Similarly, a guy's friends and his relationship do not fill the same section of his heart: he needs both, and prefers when they fit together comfortably. 3. Honesty and decency Men don't like being cheated on or lied to any more than women do. If you're a chew 'em up and spit 'em out type, your life will be a string of one-night stands followed by a bitter spinsterhood. You man must feel he can trust you without question, and it is your behavior that will ensure he does. 4. Independence This is a tricky one, and it doesn't apply to every man in the wild, but there's a good chance he prefers to be with someone who can own and operate their daily lives. The complaint that he needs his "space" when a relationship sours is actually an indication that he feels constricted by your failure to manage your own affairs and respect his occasional need for privacy. You made it to adulthood without him; surely you can continue being self-sufficient now. 5. Comprehension of differences Men, being from Mars, think before they feel. When men discuss problems, they do not commiserate, they offer solutions. This creates a huge communication gap in relationships, because a woman wants emotional support while the guy uncomprehendingly suggests a resolution. Neither side is right or wrong, but women are hard wired to be feelers and men are hard wired to be thinkers. Understanding that he is not being callous or short when he tells you what he thinks rather than what he feels will score you lots of points. Men are complicated beasts, and it's no wonder that women still struggle to figure out what motivates them. We're all people, but there are some fundamental differences, and equally fundamental misconceptions, in what each gender wants from the other. But men aren't the shallow goobers they're sometimes made out to be, and giving them the benefit of the doubt in this will mean lots of potential mates from which to choose.

i can't believe that things would turn out this way for me...i try not to think negatively about the situation but i can't help it. ok, maybe im just feeling bad about nothing. i might be over reacting. hey,i don't want to shout or what. but i just feel so bad already. as if nothing happened! ok,so he might be "too busy" with his "new life" right now. and obviously, im not even a part of his so-called "new life" now. evaluating everything that i've done in the past: i wasn't quiet aggressive nor complacent. a couple of times,i've been forward (but in a good way, i guess). coz it's really obvious that he needs a little pushing or shove from his side. and i believe i let him out a little. (which im really happy about) i've been honest with myself and to him all the time.

it's my fault Chona, not yours. you and I will have a long talk about this. ryt now is not the time. i still got personal issues that needs to be taken care of. I'm sorry if I really made you fell bad but believe me, I didn't do it to hurt you.

hi! i was suppose to write you a letter and send it to you there but i read your blog the other day and you've transferred na pala. anyways, i really wanted it written coz email seems impersonal (just for this particular one). i really don't know where to begin.... the past few months, i admit that i really felt sad. we've lost touch. i don't know if its just me but i really felt that you've been avoiding me.almost all of the time, im the one who would initiate the first move to email you.maybe you have your reasons like you're just too busy adjusting to your new life there and looking for a job and preparing coz you'll be moving out to your new home. so i tried to understand you. i really don't want to make you think that im pushing myself too much on you.that i could be this "bitch" bugging you all the time and being nosy as well. i gave you space.i continued reading your blogs and honestly you got me worried when you mentioned that you're not doing "good" in this adjustment phase.you seem to have doubts,apprehensions,regrets (maybe) and other "mixed" emotions about this transition that you're in right now. and as your friend, i do empathize with you coz i have been in this stage also just recently.i was just ahead of you for a couple of months.but in those months that i was out of work,no income,far from home...i felt like giving up.i did feel down most of the time and also depressed.maybe im just good in hiding and dealing with it.you never knew about it nor did my closest friends and my family.instead of sulking and surrendering, i fought back.you ask where i got my strength? 1)my family and friends who believe in me 2)my drive to reach my ambition 3)you. those days when i was just in my aunt's apartment still waiting for news of our canada trip and at the same time trying to find a job here in manila...i was really so confused and very lost and i felt like my life IS going down.i hurriedly resigned from my job of 5 yrs and i left my home (family and friends) with such a short notice.im in the starting line again...starting from scratch...new environment away from home.i was so used to my life back home that what i did (of leaving it all) was such a big leap.and when i was faced with the reality that our trip will not push through after all..i somehow panicked.what will i do?there is no job waiting for me back home...i have to find one soon.there were bills to pay and i have to contribute with my aunt's apartment also. but all these time...you never heard me talking about this...or me complaining or worrying or whatever...honestly,everytime we talked during those times i felt very happy and relieved...you were like my refuge...talking to you made me forget about the "storm" i was going through... when i would have problems,i would try my best to solve it on my own...i never share my worries with other people (especially my family) coz i don't want other people to worry about me...i tell myself that i can handle it...coz i really believe that God would never give us any problems we cant solve.all the answers are there...we just have to look for it and along the way we should be sensitive and patient in searching for the answers. with all these things im sharing with you right now...you ask: where is these all going? ok...honestly, right now, i just feel so angry with you & myself. why? coz of the fact that you are "shutting" me off (again). i ask myself what did i do to deserve this kind of treatment from you? if your memory serves you right...you did this to me before...again...if i just let my "maldita" me get in the way...hindi na rin kita papansinin...and i just want to reiterate again...i don't want to do this to you coz i know you don't deserve this kind of treatment from me...i don't want to lose a friend nor do i want to gain an enemy in the process...but im just so hurt with all your "cold treatment". i dont want to nag or anything...i just want you to know how ive been feeling in the last months...there is never a day that i dont think of you and how you are coping with the phase you're in now... i really feel bad also coz when i sent you some forwarded emails where you have to answer it...you do answer it...BUT you don't answer MY personal email to you...and what really ticked me off the other day was...you even have a second (not even a minute) to post that "..." comment in myspace.com. again, i ask you:what was that suppose to mean??? and fyi (even if you ask me or not/if you care or not) he IS not my boyfrient (right he is NOT) but my coworker who is not even my close gf (girlfriend) at work but IS my gf (GAYfriend)...yup!he IS so gay!!!more girly that me for that matter... honesty...honesty...i really cant explain it but ive grown to connect with you way back and in truth, ive learned to love you in some way also...thats why it really hurts me so much right now to see whats happening between us.... i just feel really, really sad if ill lose you as a friend...as ive said before...boyfriends or girlfriends or even husbands or wives get separated but once you've found a true friend...they will be with you for life and accept you for what you are... sometimes i tell myself..."bakit ko pa pagsisiksikan ang sarili ko to a person who doesn't want me...when there are still a lot of people out there who would want to have me for their friend"...again rich...i just want to save our friendship... i don't expect you to answer me back anymore...bahala ka na...this will be my last email for now and i wont even bother you with my forwarded emails as well...im not really locking my door to you...i would just close it for now coz it appears that im not yet welcome in your life... lastly...salamat talaga for all the calls and talks we had before...i did look forward to it everytime...thanks a lot for listening and talking to me....i really appreciate it...thank you again....as always...you take care of yourself...
not a day passes...yup!im trying to compose THE letter...in my thoughts (for now). its really driving me nuts on how to approach him without trying to look stupid or plain "gaga"-over-him. sigh!

almost everyday, especially when im alone, i keep on thinking about him. ha! and i don't even try to think if he is also thinking about me or not. the fact is,i am just so worried about him and his situation right now. i'm so torn with the idea of just leaving him alone and giving him a time out or if i should call or email him or send him a card.(now i think ill send him an e card instead) if i give him time off...the question is:until when? if i do write him...well,it would rather be a very long one. it would be some sort of a "goodbye-for-now-until-you're- stable-or-fine-with-yourself" type of letter. basically, i just want to be honest with him and be frank. geez! i just try to calm myself most of the time when i try to think about all these. coz there is a part of me that seems to be angry with him and another part kept telling me to be a rational being, be patient and just let it be. time IS of the essence, i believe. but then again, i don't want him to think that im like "meddling so much" with his life. LIFe is truly unfair and who says its not complicated?

i don't want to close my doors to him or anything. i'm still hoping against hope that everything will turn out positive. i'll continue to wait. whenever...whatever.... i really don't want to turn my back on him. my options will still be open. anything could happen. i just want to be prepared for any eventually. but for now, life goes on....

the week that was...had a good start on the 24th...got so mad at work on the 25th, that i was "literally" shouting at the top of my lungs explaining to my superiors 'coz they think i'm doing the wrong thing with my work. didn't report for work on the 26th. my alibi: LBM 'coz i changed the milk that i was drinking. hehe for them... i just stayed home, watched tv and slept. grouchy all day at work on the 27th. take note: i was snobbing one of my superiors and didn't eat lunch with him. i felt so mad for what they told me the other day that i felt so depressed...so i bought six new fabrics and went to my maninay lou to have it made. yippy, she finished my dress (which was with her last december) and wore it today at work. TGIF! issah and i went to pay our last respects to mrs. juventina maypa.(RIP) she used to be the student aid directress in la salle. so that would mean she's in charge of all the scholars in the university. its the first time i had a major "clash" with my junior officer since he was assigned in our branch. actually, i never thought that i would have an argument with sir miko ever. he seemed so approachable and he's like a big brother to us at the branch. but that day, i just felt exhausted of explaining to them 'coz all i'm saying seems to fall on deaf ears. even if i turn the world up side down, my explanations are futile. as if!!! as if i stole money or something!!!it was just a matter of my good judgement, fast decision-making, gut-feeling and riskless-self that bugged them that afternoon. they reprimanded me 'coz i just did the transaction without informing them. of course, i directly informed our manager 'coz i know if i ask them they won't approve it. i could really feel myself getting red and the heat rising to my head while i explained at the top of my voice. i completely lost my appetite (i was eating pandesal and pork bar-b-que) i didn't feel anything afterwards. i just frowned while finishing my transaction that afternoon and i immediately went out of the bank by 5:30 pm. to hell with them!!! i have my pride too...as if they can ask favors from the other staff? if they wanted something done..all of them ask for my help...but me?i solve it by myself..to the point that i would sometimes try my best to find all the possible solutions but if its useless...that's when i would consult them. (but these are just very rare cases 'coz most of the time, i do solve it on my own). not that i'm exagerrating or something, but its really true that all of them rely on me for help. hmmp! thanks to me and if not for me, they would be so LOST! they will have their day!!! lintik lang ang walang ganti!

we had an outing yesterday with my co-employees at the bank. we went to Guintubdan, La Carolota. it was the first time for most of us. we trekked for the falls. it was a 30 minute or so walk. we were all catching our breaths. whew! but we made it. the water was chilly ice. you can feel your body getting numb because of the coldness. we only stayed less than an hour because we headed for the nearby waterfalls. another 30 minutes of trekking. but the trip was worth it because the falls looked calming and the whole scene is indeed breathtaking. its like you can hear yourself being one with nature. soaking myself in the cold water was like communing with mother earth. the cold air and water were enough to make you be lulled to sleep. after the trip, we went back to the pavilion and prepared lunch. i felt sleepy. so while waiting for lunch, i slept. (one of my officer's supervised the cooking so all of us girls just waited, hehe!) food trip...tilapia, squid, bangus, pork bbq, grilled pork, tinolang manok, ripe mangoes and watermelon. fiesta to the max. all of us girls stayed in the pavilion the rest of the afternoon while the boys trekked to another waterfalls. just enjoyed looking at the scenery since the pavilion overlooked some parts of negros. even mount kanlaon was visible already. we used a different route when we went back to bacolod. it was the first time i felt proud to be born in negros. why? because we are a hundredtimes better than cebu and manila in terms of abundant trees. our mountains still have a lot of greens in them. i especially loved the pine trees. its as if i was in baguio. even the zigzag roads were like that of canon road too. (fyi, i haven't been to baguio but its just the ones i see on tv) we passed buenos aires in ma-ao. the last stop was in our manager's poulty farm. we enjoyed the fresh eggs picking. each of us had a dozen eggs to take home. yippy!!! sigh!! the day was very tiring but very fun indeed. i got a tan too. our next outing will be on april 9...salvador benedicto. looking forward to it.

last monday, march 10, apple (she works in the treasury dept. of our bank) has been bugging me to apply for a position in our treasury dept. she wants me to take her place. why? coz she's not happy there anymore. besides, her present position requires her to undergo the officership training program and she doesn't want to become an officer either. i have no problem deciding. of course, i'll apply but what kept me back was having to ask my bos' approval on the matter. so i kept postponing it and told apple that i'll hand in my application tomorrow. so this afternoon, i asked my manager. good thing he accepted it nicely and even saying that "much as he would like to keep me with the branch", he also wanted me to advance in my career and have my own job growth also. i was so relieved afterwards. thank god. so tomorrow, i'll let him sign my application. i pray that i'll get the position. it would really be a breather for me after 5 years of staying in the branch. a new direction and a new environment. i'll be able to understand the banking process in a different perspective.

got nothing to do...so i was just opening my old emails. last feb 19, richie n. informed me (thru email) of his online diary website. it was such a long time since i heard from him (or got an email for that matter). i didn't try to view that website up until tonight. right!...coz i've got nothing to do. this site is kinda cool and so i signed up too. :) thanks to richie. i have always loved writing my thoughts. high school...had my diary. college...didn't write that much but i kept a journal too. and when i browse through those books, i would find myself smiling (and sometimes laughing) for it indeed had my out-of-this world thoughts, feelings, views, or opinions. my work involves a lot of writing and at the end of the day my fingers hurt or get tired already. so i kinda stopped the writing stuff. typing is no problem for me. i'd be better off typing than let me write for that matter. so this explains why i'll have fun writing here. since we are in the "IT" or "NET" age or whatever you call it, this site is surely a blessing. :) no more paper to write on. more trees to save (yippy!). you can even share this to your friend who is living in the other side of the world. privacy? well, i have nothing to hide nor do i have any millions. so i guess nobody out there would be interested in having this site monitored or something. hehe! just something i'll enjoy and have fun with.

holy week..long vacation..already over...and where did i end up this time? miriam,apple and i went to maricon's place in himamaylan..2 hr ride..160 km (more or less) away from bacolod. ate and slept most of the time..while miriam and apple played tong-its and mahjong..i was either sleeping or dipping myself in the cute swimming pool (haha..its about 2 ft high, so i guess you can call it an oversized tub already). the place is around 4 hectares most of which is the fish pond where they grow and breed bangus/tilapia/alimango/shrimp. a lot of fruit trees like mango, santol, pineapple, banana, kasoy and many others surround the whole area. sigh!the place is so quiet, calm, peaceful, relaxing..a little hot but thanks to the cool sea breeze..i already felt relieved. if only i could stay their forever...you really get to "clear" your thoughts when you are in a place like that..that's why maricon's family call it paradise..it is PARADISE! we get to take home a bagful of mangoes..its mango season right now..ill definitely go back there one of this days...thanks to maricon and her family..especially mama linda (her mom).

just another huhum week for my simple life... highlights.... had dinner with ronald and miriam last night. we don't get to hang out with ronald anymore for a couple of months now since maricon (his wife) got pregnant. she's in manila right now..being closely monitored by her obgyne. that's why ronald has to go to manila all the time..to be there for her. sigh! we miss maricon so much...but we are very happy for both of them coz after 4 years..they're gonna have a baby..this baby is really a survivor..maricon already had two miscarriages..bless this child..we can't wait for her to be born...(right its a girl!) shockingly,surprisingly,unexpectedly...richie called me last night. i thought it was dan coz before my celfone rang...i got a text message from him (actually, the message was sent..early part of the morning). i used my postpaid number the whole day and when i got home, that's when i reverted to my prepaid number...i just remembered that..i emailed my number to richie before...touched by the effort that he kept it. had a nice conversation with him and i sort of learned some things about the navy stuff or so...

wow!it's april...can't believe it!had the week off from work.vacation leave for four days-april 1 to 4. my only vacation and breather for the whole year. pity me!!! i couldn't go anywhere for my vacation. like manila or baguio.. why? coz im nearly broke. actually, i am broke. huhuhu!!! well, i made most of my week. first day..i was just home all day and visited the bank in the afternoon to key in my vacation leave for the approval of my immediate supervisor. then had dinner at tita dako in rosario heights..9th day after her burial. bless her... second day..my cousin manang yuhsa and i went to AMERICAN DREAM AGENCY. ya that's the name but we inquired about immigrations in New Zealand. haha! well, i somehow passed the initial point system. i got 23. the cut-off is 24 but they say i'll sort of "fast track" my application if i'm interested. i am interested but (READ THIS): no financial assistance. grr!! i need at least 150K to process everything. but it will all be in staggered payments. sigh! after this, we went to robinsons. happy to say i bought a new two piece bathing suit. just in time for the summer swimming i'll do. haha! third day..apple, joan and i went to panaad sa negros..that's in mansilingan.had dinner at sagay booth. wow!our dinner was for free because tito noknoy said its on the house. got home by 10 pm. fourth day..manang yuhsa and i had a dip in celine homes' swimming pool. got to use my new suit and got a nice tan too (especially at my back). but i felt a little sting at my shoulders area. saturday..me,apple,miriam and her friend stayed overnight at sunburst ray resort in silay. night swimming from 9 until 11 pm. i felt like were turning into prunes..the water was just right to cool our sweaty bodies. its summer and its very hot out here. had a little swim in the morning. after our lunch, we all headed home... i really enjoyed our overnight and the swimming too. its a holiday tomorrow. in lieu of the april 9 (araw ng kagitingan) holiday. i'll just stay home and prepare my strength for the work ahead. at least i'm all charged up and hopefully face my work again...
june already...ha!three weeks..me alone at work...i'm in control...i made it..nine more weeks to go...

at the last minute...i decided to enroll my last and only remaining subject before i am qualified to take the licensure exam for teachers (LET) for august next year...thanks to my cousin ng yuhsa..i asked her to process my enrollment yesterday..and i am officially a student again..i got the 3 hr saturday classes..8 to 11 am..the only schedule i wanted to have for my class..since every saturday afternoon, i have to report to the bank..one subject won't be too much hassle for me.. the past few days and nights...my mind has been preoccupied with a lot of things... my..and i cant believe that my work with the bank right now...doesn't bother me at all..i mean..the thought that im all alone in the new accounts section for three months...until august...its the least of my worries right now... so whats this...thats preoccupying my thoughts...??? EXCITEMENT...about what?i really dont know...but the thought of excitement...excites me..haha!!wierd?really..it is weird! its like...i'm expecting something soon that would make me happy...like a child waiting for her turn to talk to santa claus..this is really,really weird... also..i've got a lot of plans in my head right now on what career paths ill have in the next five years...i'm trying to sort out which opportunity would come first...im just waiting for our head office's decision regarding my request for transfer with our treasury department...if in case i get the position...i'll enroll for nursing by october next yr...well..taking into consideration that i'll pass the LET next yr. also, being an officer in the bank will give me a three yr contract to stay with the company...just in time for me to finish my course in nursing...and so...my plans are in place...(now im just hoping and praying that i get the position).plan B would be..if in case i don't get the position...i'll take a part time job as a teacher in high school...then continue with my masterals in education... sigh!! really a lot of things that i wanted to do and to accomplish...but it seems like im just short of time and all...but with all these plans...it keeps me going on and giving me something to live on and think of...its like a self-fulfillment and self-accomplishment for me.. im really praying that these are also God's plans for me

Though we’ve know each other for just a short while, I feel the sincere friendship you’ve shown me. Thank you very much for the happy memories we had together. We may not see each other day by day, but our bond of friendship will surely remain. Happy memories are always treasured. I pray that I’m a part of your happy memories. Life is a constant change. I’m hoping that our friendship will still remain. Your beautiful smile always lights up a gloomy face. Thanks for sharing your smile with me. Smile, my friend and remember the good old times. Weren’t we happy and delighted of life’s simple pleasures? People come and go… But friends stick together through thick and thin. Rivers, valleys and mountains may set us apart… Yet, the happy moments will be treasured in my heart. I like you very much… Can we be friends? We laughed and cried, sang songs and talked about life… I never knew that our friendship could last this long. We learn a lot from our mistakes. Thanks for correcting my errors. It is really God’s will that we become friends. And I’m grateful to Him for your love and presence. I hope that our friendship will go on though we may not see each other too often. Just remember our happy times together. Smile and think of our happy moments together… Thank you for remembering me. Friends bring out the best and the worst in me. Thanks for being my friend. I feel secure and comfortable when you’re around. I hope this good vibration continues. A common experience binds people together. I hope you’ll remember what we’ve gone through. Friendship makes people belong. I’m glad to be a part of your circle of friends. My dearest friend, may God continue to guide you all the days of your life. Never forget that I’m here, praying for your safety. We’ve been through a lot of ups and downs in life, my friend. I’m lucky to have known you all these years. I’m sorry for hurting your feelings. I hope we can still be friends. Friends become closer when they learn to forgive and forget. Thanks for your forgiveness. Just dropping by to say, “hope you’re doing fine and you’re ok”. Miss you then, miss you now…I wish my message reaches you somehow.
mother's day..my family went to sunburst ray resort..had lunch there..i didn't get any tan at all coz it was so cloudy...have to get a good tan before this summer ends...

janis and her family prepared dinner last night...sort of thanksgiving and going away get together na rin..who were there?geralyn, her baby shelly, llewelyn, tan2 (janis' bf), me and syempre cheng, rainier and baby ziv. so...we were just there all night talking, laughing..picture taking...sigh! its just like any other night...well...our last time to hang out with janis before she leaves...

my..it was my 5th yr. anniversary with the bank last may 5..can't believe it!i've been working for five years already. and its like i've been there all my life...have to come up with my new set of goals...short term and long term...i really can't see myself staying another five years for that matter...but then..where will i be? i'm so clueless..this is bad..tsk..tsk..

"all my life, i prayed for someone like you. and i thank god, that i finally found you." kc and jojo...1998..its been awhile since i heard this song. i just listened to it being played on the radio. i don't know why, but everytime i hear the song it still gives me that shiver and makes my heart skip and race...and....i dunno!!!one of my favorite songs... but the one which im kinda attached to...but i just want to remember the song...nothing more...coz the rest is history..that i don't want to dwell on, but one that i'm still thankful for until now.. even if i still regret my decisions but because of those decisions...my life had a different turn..it made me realize that there is always a reason for everything...

it's like i'm back from a deep and long slumber... ok..janis is going to boston,massachuset on the 15th..we will say our goodbyes to her on the 12th, when she's going to manila already with her sister and bro-in-law..i'm planning a last farewell gimik for her this saturday..dinner and all with cheng, rainier, llewelyn,roy (not sure if he'll go with us), tan-tan and geralyn...just thinking about it now makes me sad...i'm still in the stage of trying to accept the fact that one of my very best friends will be going out of the country soon...ya! i know she'll be back next year but its like a part of me will always be missing. janis and i have gone through a lot...we practically know each other's secrets and the little regretful things we did back then...i have always been the strong-willed person in our barkada..unlike janis..who is so good..you can't even tell if she's already mad with you or not..sometimes, i would even scold her for being so soft-hearted..when its already obvious that people are taking advantage of her kindness...i'm really going to miss scolding her...actually, i think not...she's just a phone call away...and of course, the email sermons from me will always reach her..haha!i'm gonna give her a very big and long hug when she leaves...i'll terribly miss her..god bless her out there.. nisa will be on maternity leave by next week..prepare myself...for 3 long months of doing everything in the new accounts..i'm programming myself not to expect help coz i know...i'll just be disappointed...i've done it once...and that was for almost 6 months...i can do it again!!!i'll live through this...i will!!!waaaaaahhhhh!!!!i'm praying that i'll be patient...all the way...

One more month to go…. Time really flies. Yup! I deliberately avoided counting the days and even don’t look at any calendar for too long. And before I knew it…ha! A month has gone by already…yippy!!! A lot of good things have happened at work. For starters, last June 16, our newly-hired employee already started working. Obviously, Irene had to help me out at the new accounts. She learns fast. I’m really impressed. By the second day at work, she’s already opening most of the new accounts. Minimal mistakes also…She catches up with everything that I taught her. Hm? Maybe I’m just a good teacher after all. Haha! Another good thing that’s going to happen at work…Irene will take my place. Actually, I’m still going to be with the new accounts but I’ll be working in the backroom. When Nisa comes back, Kristin (she’s a teller) and me, will be the new partners. Not too much pressure anymore, unlike when I’m working in front of a lot people. All of them wanting to be served all at once. Our supervisors are done with our semi-annual ratings. My, I’m so happy because I got an over-all rating of 97%. If upper management will approve my rating, my boss recommended me for promotion from a level 2 to level 8. Wow indeed! As in like I literally “jumped” in my position level. Well deserved..As they keep telling me. Hehe! And even long overdue for that matter. I’m really praying I’ll get it. My Saturday classes already started. Good thing I know someone inside the class. At least I’ll have a buddy when group works and projects come in.

life is indeed a roller coaster of events... happiness times two last wednesday...Dan's box and janis' letter arrived. I really appreciate Dan’s thoughtfulness…he sent me all these stuffed toys, chocolates and foodstuff, camping mattress, ‘hawaiian-inspired’ fabrics, scented candles, lotion and cologne, van gogh’s starry night, a hard-bound journal, picture frame, bag, cap, a tshirt for me and my bro, brain teaser game, and an accessory toy where you can make bracelets, earrings and necklaces made of colored paper patterns (which I gave to my cousin). I shared the chocolates with my friends and will give some of the stuffed toys to my two inaanak. Dan is really so good to me…I can’t seem to measure up with all the kindness he has shown me… Janis sent me a letter with pictures of Boston… downtown area and Harvard university. She’s not yet working since she still has to take the nclex. however, there is still no scheduled exam yet…so all she does there is study… she misses us a lot and would cry… but, she’s holding on… I’ll write her tomorrow. Thursday… I was fighting back the tears, but I can’t, so I turned my back from my workplace (where more than four persons are waiting for me to finish their bank transactions) and I headed for the CR… it was indeed a comfort room for me. And I just started to cry. I stayed there for a good 15-20 minutes…crying my heart out. It was already past 2 pm and I haven’t eaten lunch yet…work and time pressure coupled with a hungry stomach bugged me down… and that would definitely make anyone breakdown into tears. I was just so drained: physically and emotionally… I’m so overworked and my superiors know it, but they can’t do anything about it. I’ve always wished and prayed that I deserve a better job… one which I will enjoy and love doing, with good compensation, of course… my present work is not making me happy anymore and with a very obvious fact that I’m not well-compensated either… but I’m just waiting for the results of my application with our treasury dept. and passing the LET next yr. hopefully, things will turn out in its proper place…i'm praying...

Ok…so where do I begin? My day was kinda ok…until lunch time came…I heard my co-workers talking at the back. Our Clearing Dept. will be needing a staff to replace one of their personnel named Ronnie. They were asking for the reason why Ronnie will transfer. And you know the reason why? He got accepted with the Treasury Dept. I felt my heart dropping..my whole body getting numb.. I was in the verge of crying… I kept my mouth shut...I didn’t talk to anyone… I kept myself busy..acting as if I didn’t care about what they were talking and all…wow...of all the things…by far…I think this is the worst insult I’ve encountered in my whole banking career…another reality in life…another testament…especially in this cruel world of greed and power…”Its not what you know that counts…its whom you know.” I thought there were only three of us who applied for treasury…me., Ferrer (from Loans Dept.) and Gary (from Cash Center). Among us three…(not that I’m bragging or what) I’m the most qualified because I’m already familiar with some of the transactions with Treasury… unlike the two guys…they both handle two different depts. Not related in any way with treasury…and what about Ronnie? Hey…he is with our Clearing dept…another separate dept. not related with treasury…so how come he got the position? Don’t have a clue…he may be older than me…and he just joined our bank the same year I did or just a year earlier…but the point is…knowledge of bank products and services?…I know more things that he does… Am I sour graping or what? Well, I could just go on with this…but I’ll stop…ok…I just want to get out some steam…. I’m just really hurt with the outcome. Life is really unfair!…but then again…maybe God has other plans for me…yup! I did pray for Him to give me this position…but He didn’t give it to me…and so He has other plans…maybe better plans for me… so again…I just go back…everything does happen for a reason… whatever the reason…only God knows…so... His will be done….

I'll be sending this essay next week to our Treasury Dept. I'm scheduled to be interviewed on July 17. Nervous and excited at the same time...Can't wait for the day to come. I'm really praying to GOD that i get the position..I pray I do get it... I have been with our bank for five years now. And I have considered Gatuslao-Bacolod branch as my second home. My branch head, Atty. Henry S. Yap and two junior officers, Arly P. Famoso and Michael Conrad M. Topacio, whom I consider my mentors, have always encouraged us to take on the challenge of becoming officers if an opportunity comes. It has been one of my aspirations to become a bank officer. When I was informed of the opening with the Treasury Desk - Bacolod, I requested for my superiors’ approval and submitted my application with Ma’am Bettina Ascalon. My work in the new accounts helped me to understand and deal with all kinds of people and to cater to their different banking needs. I learned to market and cross-sell our bank products and services. I also gained knowledge in terms of branch operations. The seminars and lectures I’ve undergone aided me to better comprehend the job I’ve been handling. The entire banking system is very complex. Being assigned to the branch for five years has enabled me to know just a part of what banking is about. If I’ll be given the option to work with the Treasury Department, it will allow me to discover more and better appreciate banking per se. As of now, I’m only familiar with a fraction of the treasury transactions. This opening will indeed be a new test for me and make me grow as a person and likewise for my career advancement. C.M.B.E. Customer Service Asst.-New Accounts Gatuslao-Bacolod Branch (215)
time really flies...and before we know it...a day has gone by...four months until the year ends...

everything at work seems ok...kinda busy as always...but we're getting by each day...tired but enjoying ourselves with a few laughs and all...and the thing i enjoy the most are the times we eat out...all of us...officers and staff...and the videoke sessions...singing our hearts out and dancing to all the songs... school? maybe its because im taking one subject right now thats why i don't feel like im studying or anything...i call it "the detached feeling" from school...its our midterms tomorrow and i haven't started with my studying yet...tsk!tsk!bad me. :( love life? duh! sounds alien to me right now. haha! with my work and school...that doesn't leave me time for a date...yikes! i dunno, maybe im just preoccupied with my life right now...planning for my own future and all...well, they say the right one will just come along. im patient and im still waiting. there is this question that i read in a book..."when the right one comes, are you prepared?" haha! that definitely hit me...i dunno if im doing anything right now to prepare myself...yup! but i do pray to God that He will help me prepare when that right one comes...

yup! its just the age and the years...but nothing has changed. that is what we usually think. but honestly, some things have indeed become different. as we grow older, we look at life in a different perspective. our views and opinions about everything do change...and as we grow older, we become realistic. oh my!i don't know why, but i've been trying to recall my life...my 26 years...and i would laugh at myself because a lot of things i did with my life right now is far off from what i thought and expected my life would be...choosing decisions in our life can greatly affect us...i would sometimes tell myself...ten years ago, i wouldn't expect myself to act, think, or say anything in a certain manner...well, i guess, that is part of becoming mature...or maybe im just getting wiser (or dumber) haha! one thing for sure...im more cautious and i think a lot before deciding...i can't blame anyone, only myself.

I miss hanging out with cheng and janis... : ( I miss my high school friends... : ( most of them work in manila and they've been asking me when i'll visit them... probably next year... hopefully... : ) i miss our long talks... reminiscing our high school days... updates about our lives... future plans...

Jumping from bad news to good news… So I didn’t get a shot with treasury…Fine with me. Well, at least I got my request from my officers. At last, they transferred me.. I’ll do the backroom transactions for our branch and my new partner is Tin-Tin (she’s also a teller). I turned over most of my work to Irene (our new hiree). I started last July 31. I’m informing most of the clients of my transfer. For now, I’m still adjusting with my new work. This transition period is really new to me. And I’m quiet confused myself because a lot of things have to be learned all at once, and at the same time many clients are still looking for me. Good thing I once handled this position. So it’s like, I just have to review what I did before. No more “people-pressure”. All day, I’m just at the back…facing the computer to encode the accounting entries for the day, print reports, read and answer the emails of the officers, and answer the phone of course. Haha! Sounds easy? Yup…you bet! A hundred times easier compared to being in front. I’ll definitely show the officers that I’ll do better with my new job. And I’ll really love it more.

A month and a half since I transferred at the back… I’m doing well and loving my work. Still a few prioritizing and organization to do… Some bank files to read…All is well… I still haven’t started with my LET review yet…Time frame…I’ll start January 1, 2004. “BER” months…It’s going to be busy again at the bank…longer nights…shorter days…more time to sleep…hopefully. Before the year ends…I wish I can have another vacation again…First week of December… my friend plans to take me to Boracay. I’ve been there a decade ago…when the island still doesn’t have electricity and not much resto bars and discos.
there seems to be a lot of things that is on my mind a couple of days now... i just don't know where to start...it's like everything around me passes by so fast...i can't seem to catch up...

when loving someone, never regret what you did...only regret what you never did. its not a matter of finding the right person but its a matter of being the right person for the one you choose to love. being happy doesn't mean that everything is perfect. it just means you've decided to see life beyond imperfections. so don't say you're happy because everything is alright. be happy because everything sucks but you're doing just fine.
absent from work today...just have this terrible headache...i think its related to my eye strain...ill just have to take a rest...
i just want to remember this day...when my bro was able to fix the modem and im "on-line" again! THANK YOU!!!

October 20, 2003 Manic Monday! It was kinda “hell” at the bank today. A lot of people were queuing. Since we didn’t open last Saturday, many depositors had to do their transactions today. And my, we encoded a lot of checks today. Sorry but no amounts, but the number of pieces…hm? Well, I can best describe it in terms of thickness. So its about more than 6 inches thick or high, whatever you want to call it. And all morning, I was just helping out in endorsing the checks and segregating it. Not to mention, I had to call clients and answer to bank queries over the phone. Talk about having a lot of hands and keeping my ears and eyes alert to all the people coming in and out of the bank. (yup! I’m assigned in the backroom but my table is somewhat near the vault. So I better be “aware” of the people coming near my area.) I was getting “grouchy” already since my superiors are “ordering” me around to do this, check that out, call this number, give this to whoever and all that stuff. Hey!!! Even Supergirl had her weakness! So I was kinda answering back to them and to the point that I was “spitting” out sarcasm. At times, I would ignore them altogether and just continue with my work. And again, Kristin and I ate lunch at about 2 pm or so. And what really blew me off today? When my manager was saying that I can’t have my vacation leave this December. Yeah, I know that we are not allowed to have a vacation on December but well, I already asked permission from my junior officer. I’m looking forward to this vacation. I definitely deserve a break! No one can stop me. October 19, 2003 Highlight of the annual Masskara Festival here in our city. I am home alone…just listening to the music cds given by Irene (my co-worker). She let me choose songs from her pc and “burned” it for me…and that’s nine cds all in all. She’s so good. My bro is asking me to buy the modem for the pc. I’ll look for one next week and hopefully again…this time…it will be fixed… Ok… on the lighter side… some good news I just got this Monday morning at work. I got promoted! Actually, I still haven’t received a letter from our HRD of my change in job level. But well, a very good proof is my payslip. Yup! I did get an increase. Not much but the fact that I got promoted is already good news for me. I’m really thankful to my officers, especially to our manager. THANK YOU GOD for everything. October 14, 2003 Its been 3 weeks and the pc’s modem is not yet fixed. Gr!!! Hopefully, next Saturday morning I’ll be home when the technician fixes it. So how’s life been to me? So far…so good. I’m finished with my class for the semester. Work at the bank? Bearable. But the one thing I still can’t seem to accomplish…gaining weight. Ha! Its easy for others, but for me? No way. Its like an impossible dream. I’m a mere 77 lbs. only. My goal: to gain 10 or 15 lbs. Sounds simple. I do eat but my stomach gets full easily. As my brother tells me, I just have high metabolism. So I easily “burn” what I eat. And another thing, I move so fast while working. I can’t seem to stay in one place for too long. As my officers and co-workers tell me, that I’m so “alert” and my manager even calls me SUPERWOMAN. Haha! The only skinny superwoman on earth. Sigh! Everytime I see someone way back in my high school and college days, they tell me I’m still the same. I never gained anything. But the one thing I’m thankful for, I was never sickly.
my...its been 3 weeks...and our pc is not yet fixed...i miss writing here... a lot of things and events have passed by and i wasn't able to write anything...

The strands in your eyes that color them wonderful • Stop me and steal my breath • Emeralds from mountains thrust towards the sky • Never revealing their depth • Tell me that we belong together Dress it up with the trappings of love • I'll be captivated, I'll hang from your lips • Instead of the gallows of heartache that hang from above • I'll be your cryin' shoulder • I'll be love suicide • I'll be better when I'm older • I'll be the greatest fan of your life • Rain falls angry on the tin roof • As we lie awake in my bed • You're my survival, you're my living proof • My love is alive and not dead • Tell me that we belong together • Dress it up in the trappings of love • I'll be captivated, I'll hang from your lips • Instead of the gallows of heartache that hang from above • Chorus • I've dropped out, burned up, fought my way back from the dead • Tuned in, turned on, remembered the thing you said •

yesterday night...at around 11pm or so...there was an earthquake...i was reading my emails and i could see the monitor shaking...its like there is this big thunder rumbling...it lasted for more than 10 seconds...i called on to mom and my brother coz they were both in their rooms already...i have to admit i got scared at that moment... mom turned on the radio and they were saying that they also felt the shaking and all... intensity 3 here in bacolod and the center was in iloilo...intensity 4...reason...i dunno..mom just heard it on tv this afternoon...

no work tomorrow...our president declared it a holiday...RAMADAN... whoa!!!next week...ill be going on my much awaited vacation....more time for me to be away from work...sort out things...plan everything....

i didn't report for work yesterday...i decided to visit cheng and helped babysit her two kids. its really true what they say... when you have problems or "stressed" out, just look at the babies and you'll feel relaxed and all your worries seem to vanish in an instant. i just cant help but stare at baby paolo...so fragile and innocent...holding him was like my responsibility for that time...to make sure that he burps after he was fed...to make sure he doesn't cry and that im holding him properly or something like i might break a bone in his tiny body... my...such a small creature...and he was carried by my friend for nine months!life's a miracle! just looking at him makes me smile...at that moment...he was like my refuge.

take life one day at a time ...i've read this somewhere...and it just crossed my mind right now...

my bos, sir arly (he's my direct supervisor at the bank), was rushed to the hospital yesterday afternoon. he was in the parking lot when his arms felt numb and in seconds he was down on the ground having a seizure. good thing a guard saw him and asked for help. we were so shocked. our iloilo trip was cancelled. we visited him today and the results of his CAT scan showed a raptured vein in his brain.he looked ok but with a bruise on his right cheek due to the fall.the doctor said the blood clot can be "dissolved".but sir arly will have to go to manila to be thoroughly examined by specialists.just to be sure that his condition is ok. we were all so worried about what happened to him.and he is like a father to us and our barkada too.he makes us laugh a lot.the branch is unusually quiet if he is not around. we're all praying that his condition will improve.

i talked to cheng this morning and checked out on her two baby boys and how they were doing...i'm happy for her coz she's a fulfilled mother at 26. god bless her and her family. we're planning to go to iloilo this weekend...me & my co-workers were suppose to go there this month end..change of plans...so they're planning to go this saturday..we will just close early so we can catch up with the last ferry trip. i said i'll go, then i decided not to and then again...i'll go. whew!!! there goes the undecided me... and cheng even reminded me of my boracay trip. my! im so lost...i completely forgot about it already. my mind seems to be...i dunno..."clouded". its like i lost my focus at work...no concentration whatsoever...big dilemma...
as the days go by...i can't help but imagine what life would be out there...good thing i won't be alone.one thing that scares me though is the weather...

if things will materialize...what will happen?this is definitely a big step for me...there's no more turning back...i'll just have to look forward...take the risk...a big test to prove to myself and to others that i can be independent...i can do this! i'm praying....
november and december...2 more months...what's next?i just feel so confused and a bit undecided about my life right now...
five more weeks...boracay...im back!!!yippy!!!
im at maricon and ronald's place tonight..and obviously im using their pc...im helping ronald install yahoo messenger...

i was the commentator at christina's wedding today (she's my high school classmate). it was a simple wedding,attended by relatives and close friends. i love attending weddings...especially if i play a certain role...it just makes me happy to help out (in any way) what my friends wanted me to accomplish on their special day.

it was vincent's birthday yesterday...my classmates and i visited him...his family offered mass for him and we headed to the memorial park afterwards...rest in peace.... just a thought...there is a time in our life when we meet a person,know him,be friends with him and sometimes we end up having bad memories and experiences with that person....time truly heals all wounds and who would have thought that you could become good friends again.we meet more people in our lives.however,as time goes by,this person enters our life again.so its like you have to meet the wrong persons first and then you come back again?its like you have taken the wrong turns but in the end, you'll still get to your destination.its like you took the rocky road or crooked road....life...very confusing

I have learned I've learned - that you cannot make someone love you. All you can do is be someone who can be loved. The rest is up to them. I've learned - that no matter how much I care, some people just don't care back. I've learned - that it takes years to build up trust, and only seconds to destroy it. I've learned - that it's not what you have in your life but who you have in your life that counts. I've learned - that you can get by on charm for about fifteen minutes. After that, you'd better know something. I've learned - that you shouldn't compare yourself to the best others can do. I've learned - that you can do something in an instant that will give you heartache for life. I've learned - that it's taking me a long time to become the person I want to be. I've learned - that you should always leave loved ones with loving words. It may be the last time you see them. I've learned - that you can keep going long after you think you can't. I've learned - that we are responsible for what we do, no matter how we feel. I've learned - that either you control your attitude or it controls you. I've learned - that regardless of how hot and steamy a relationship is at first, the passion fades and there had better be something else to take its place. I've learned - that heroes are the people who do what has to be done when it needs to be done, regardless of the consequences. I've learned - that money is a lousy way of keeping score. I've learned - that my best friend and I can do anything or nothing and have the best time. I've learned - that sometimes the people you expect to kick you when you're down will be the ones to help you get back up. I've learned - that sometimes when I'm angry I have the right to be angry, but that doesn't give me the right to be cruel. I've learned - that true friendship continues to grow, even over the longest distance. Same goes for true love. I've learned - that just because someone doesn't love you the way you want them to doesn't mean they don't love you with all they have. I've learned - that maturity has more to do with what types of experiences you've had and what you've learned from them and less to do with how many birthdays you've celebrated. I've learned - that you should never tell a child their dreams are unlikely or outlandish. Few things are more humiliating, and what a tragedy it would be if they believed it. I've learned - that your family won't always be there for you. It may seem funny, but people you aren't related to can take care of you and love you and teach you to trust people again. Families aren't biological. I've learned - that no matter how good a friend is, they're going to hurt you every once in a while and you must forgive them for that. I've learned - that it isn't always enough to be forgiven by others. Sometimes you have to learn to forgive yourself. I've learned - that no matter how bad your heart is broken the world doesn't stop for your grief. I've learned - that our background and circumstances may have influenced who we are, but we are responsible for who we become. I've learned - that just because two people argue, it doesn't mean they don t love each other And just because they don't argue, it doesn't mean they do. I've learned - that we don't have to change friends if we understand that friends change. I've learned - that you shouldn't be so eager to find out a secret. It could change your life forever. I've learned - that two people can look at the exact same thing and see something totally different. I've learned - that no matter how you try to protect your children, they will eventually get hurt and you will hurt in the process. I've learned - that your life can be changed in a matter of hours by people who don t even know you. I've learned - that even when you think you have no more to give, when a friend cries out to you, you will find the strength to help. I've learned - that credentials on the wall do not make you a decent human being. I've learned - that the people you care most about in life are taken from you too soon. I've learned - that it's hard to determine where to draw the line between being nice and not hurting people's feelings and standing up for what you believe

im really enjoying my vacation...i never thought of work...ha!and i didn't miss it one bit.... and this is definitely some vacation...a lot of parties and get togethers to attend to...whew!!!well,i can stay up all night without having to wake up the next day for work.... its the first time i felt so free...but i don't feel myself depending on mom (well,maybe a little--financially) i do need this time out for myself...thank you lord for giving this to me....

our trip was postponed...we just knew it last night...it will be moved to february next yr.... maybe this is a blessing in disguise...coz im definitely not looking forward to the cold weather yet.... since i resigned from work...ill just use this time to take a rest and eat and sleep...(hoping that ill gain some extra pounds before i go out there).... this will be the best christmas ever....to be still here at home....
busy sunday...my friends and relatives will visit us at home today...

christmas party, farewell party and belated birthday party rolled into one last friday night... we had the grandest time...laughter and tears... my...my...im so "hard" like a stone...they all gave me their parting notes and gifts... yup!i kinda swallowed my tears...i don't want them to see me cry...i want them to remember me with that smile on my face...HAPPY and very much ready and strong to face a new world out there. GOD BLESS US ALWAYS!!!

maybe this is the effect of my excitement or anxiety (all at the same time) i cant sleep...insomnia?i dunno...come to think of it...when i was in boracay i overslept. so maybe this is some kind of a payment for my oversleeping...haha!!! my last day tomorrow at work...its gonna be one hell of a day again!!!my mind is already set...no one can stop me.... this is it...definitely it!!!

they took it so well...i didn't expect my superiors' reaction to my leaving the bank (and passing my resignation for that matter). whew!!!i am so relieved. thank you lord! they did give me their blessing and they are all so happy for me...so on friday...we'll have our christmas party and farewell party (for me)...this is so great! by monday, me and lin-lin will be off for manila...do some last minute panic buying shopping and all that stuff...and of course, i have to meet my friends...

i visited sir arly tonight at their house...he's ok...but he has to rest...no work for him yet... i "dropped the bomb" and told sir arly of my plans...he took it well...and he gave me his blessings... tomorrow...i'll drop the bomb at work...

HAPPY NEW YEAR!!! God has been so good to me and my family this 2003. I may not be the religious or prayerful type but in my heart I’m just so thankful for all the blessings. Since I started working, this is the first time that I truly enjoyed the Christmas holiday. Even if I ended up in the hospital (with my insignificant sickness-as Doc Rainier was saying), I still felt happy, happy, happy. Welcome 2004!!! So for the whole month of January, I’ll still laze around…first half of which I’ll spend here in Bacolod and the next half, until February and we take off for good, I’ll be in Manila already. Priorities for the year: (1)career; (2)love; (3)health; (4)finances. CAREER – Learn a lot from the company. Good working relationship with boss and colleagues. Don’t overwork. Enjoy the job (as much as possible). LOVE – Be open. Take the risk. Listen. HEALTH – Gain 20 lbs. (big challenge for me!) Eat more. Ask bro to help me with an exercise program. FINANCES – Settle all my credit cards. Pay mom. Full payment for my house and insurance.

a beautiful and intelligent woman said: "I know nothing is definite and sure in life. something about shreik!?! haven't watched it...don't even know if i spelled it right!froilan's sis has this toy...funny me!

my weekend was so ok...yup!me,froi,ina,marvin,myra,roy and george went to roxas blvd and witnessed the lova palooza (kiss for the record)....haha!we didn't join in....we were just there to see everybody...watched the fireworks...listen to the music....and afterwards we checked out the bars in malate....my!for a couple of weekends that ive seen the area,it was the first time that the streets and bars were full of people...like literally...people everywhere....kinda fun watching everyone and i was kinda amazed with the youngsters nowadays....

The Road Not Taken Robert Frost -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Two roads diverged in a yellow wood, And sorry I could not travel both And be one traveler, long I stood And looked down one as far as I could To where it bent in the undergrowth; Then took the other, as just as fair, And having perhaps the better claim, Because it was grassy and wanted wear; Though as for that the passing there Had worn them really about the same, And both that morning equally lay In leaves no step had trodden black. Oh, I kept the first for another day! Yet knowing how way leads on to way, I doubted if I should ever come back. I shall be telling this with a sigh Somewhere ages and ages hence: Two roads diverged in a wood, and I-- I took the one less traveled by, And that has made all the difference. From The Poetry of Robert Frost by Robert Frost, edited by Edward Connery Lathem. Copyright 1916, 1923, 1928, 1930, 1934, 1939, 1947, 1949, © 1969 by Holt Rinehart and Winston, Inc. i'll definitely have my new life here in manila...i've kinda accepted the fact that our trip IS cancelled forever...the concern right now is to get back what mommy gave to them.... all of my friends and relatives would definitely BE worried....like the money issue and all....honestly i am too, but i just don't like to worry so much about it....i wanna be focused with my training (for now) and try to move on with my life....pick up where i left off.... again...GOD has other plans for me....maybe its not yet my time....i'm dissappointed but then again i won't try to blame anyone for everything that is happening right now....He has his reasons....i don't know yet...but i'm trying to embrace what is coming my way now.... i don't feel that sad....but there is a part of me that wants to cry

3rd week of training here in rmh and its all about studying at&t products & services...we have the 11pm-6am training schedule...we just got our user ids and passwords last night...so we now have internet access...thank goodness!

Just got myself a job last march 8 with RMH teleservices asiapacific inc. its still a call center and our account is with at & t. kinda excited coz we're the second batch on training for the sales inbound group. that means its really a new batch and we have greater chances for promotion and all. if ill be going to canada or not, its still a win-win situation for me...if ill go,then good...if not...i already have work here...im really enjoying coz its a new experience for me and at the same time i get to practice my spoken english a lot (coz we'll be taking calls from the US).
a month more here in manila...with luck and GOD's blessing, i hope i get this work with SYKES co. (a call center)...
huhum night of taking calls...why do i always get 3 sales?since i started with my job, the most sales that i had was 3...something with this "3" thing!!!why can't i get more?why?why?

Pangasinan - Inaru Taka Papiamento - Mi ta stimabo Persian - Doo-set daaram Pig Latin - Iay ovlay ouyay Polish - Kocham Ciebie Portuguese - Eu te amo Romanian - Te iubesc Russian - Ya tebya liubliu Scot Gaelic - Tha gra'dh agam ort Serbian - Volim te Setswana - Ke a go rata Sign Language - ,\,,/ (represents position of fingers when signing'I Love You') Sindhi - Maa tokhe pyar kendo ahyan Sioux - Techihhila Slovak - Lu`bim ta Slovenian - Ljubim te Spanish - Te quiero / Te amo Swahili - Ninapenda wewe Swedish - Jag alskar dig Swiss-German - Ich lieb Di Tagalog - Mahal kita Taiwanese - Wa ga ei li Tahitian - Ua Here Vau Ia Oe Tamil - Nan unnai kathalikaraen Telugu - Nenu ninnu premistunnanu Thai - Chan rak khun (to male) Thai - Phom rak khun (to female) Turkish - Seni Seviyorum Ukrainian - Ya tebe kahayu Urdu - mai aap say pyaar karta hoo Vietnamese - Anh ye^u em (to female) Vietnamese - Em ye^u anh (to male) Welsh - 'Rwy'n dy garu Yiddish - Ikh hob dikh Yoruba - Mo ni fe Listening for Love By Jayne Fisher There are times when we are timid and shy about expressing the love we feel. For fear of embarrassing the other person, or ourselves, we hesitate to say the actual words "I love you". So we try to communicate the idea in other words. We say "take care" or "don't drive too fast" or "be good". But really, these are just other ways of saying "I love you". "You are important to me", "I care what happens to you", and don't want you to get hurt" all mean "I love you". We are sometimes very strange people. The only thing we want to say, and the one thing that we should say, is the one thing we don?t say. And yet because the feeling is so real, and the need to say it is so strong, we are driven to use other words and signs to say what we really mean. And many times the meaning never gets communicated at all and the other person is left feeling unloved and unwanted. Therefore, I believe we have to listen for love in the words that people are saying to us. Sometimes the explicit words are necessary, but more often, the manner of saying things is even more important. A joyous insult carries more affection and love within the sentiments, which are expressed insincerely. An impulsive hug says "I love you" even though the words might be saying something very different. Any expression of a person?s concern for another says "I love you". Sometimes the expression is clumsy, sometimes even cruel. Sometimes we must look and listen very intently for the love that it contains. We say "I love you" in many ways - with birthday gifts, and little notes, with smiles and sometimes with tears. Sometimes we show our love by just keeping quiet and not saying a word, at other times by speaking out, even harshly. We show our love sometimes by impulsiveness. Many times we have to show our love by forgiving someone who has not listened to the love we have tried to express. The problem is listening for love is that we don't always understand the language of love, which the other person is using. A girl may use tears or emotions to say what she wants to say, and her boyfriend may not understand her because he expects her to be talking his language. We have to force ourselves to really listen for love. The problem with our world is that people rarely listen to each other. They hear the words, but they don't listen to the actions that accompany the words or the expression on the face. Or people listen only for rejection or misunderstanding. They do not see the love that is there just beneath the surface, even if the words are angry. Simon and Garfunkel wrote that very haunting song, The Sound of Silence . It goes: Ten thousand people, maybe more. People talking without speaking; people hearing without listening; people writing songs that voices never shared, because no one dared disturb the sound of silence... It is a terrifying picture of our modern world, a world without communication and without love. We have to listen for love in those around us. If we listen intently we will discover that we are a lot more loved than we realise. Just listen!

im more determined than ever to make everything clear,be frank and say it all in the open....maybe one reason why there seems to be a lot of confusion lately was due to my fault also....but i want it all to be crystal clear....ill be honest and truthful with myself and what i feel.... whatever will happen....at least i have a clear conscience that i said everything...yup!like ill reveal it all....i know i wont regret saying all these.... i just dont want to make the same mistakes i did before in the past....i dont want to lose someone in this process...nor do i want to hurt myself or that person.... im just so hurt right now and i cant help but think where this will all end....coz i don't want everything to end soon....and i never even thought of any bad ending for that matter....not even in my dreams.... :( (sob!sob!)

not sleeping for 2 straight days has taken its toll on me last saturday...i slept for 14 hours (8am-9pm)....i wont drink that much coffee again...EVER!!! this silence is killing me....im trying my very best to speak out...reach out and try to make things clear but to no avail....its like everything is falling on deaf ears or something....ive been eating my pride a lot of times...actually almost all the time....but all i get is cold silence in return.... honestly....i dont want to give up....ill keep on trying...coz i wont like to think that someday ill regret everything coz i didn't do anything to save it....everything that happens to me is just a "domino effect" of life....but instead of just accepting what is coming my way....ill definitely make a change with my life....coz i KNOW i can still make a difference....HE doesn't give us any problems we cant handle.... after all this time....im still optimistic....everything will have a good ending to it....im praying and i WILL it....

issah (teller co-worker before) called me yesterday morning coz she was here in manila for an interview...she's applying for the officer position with the bank.i met her afterwards and we were together the whole day yesterday...RIGHT!the whole day i didn't have a chance to rest and sleep...coz i didn't feel sleepy or anything...but when we rode the taxi...i started to feel sleepy...and so, the whole 30 minutes or so trip...i slept...i got home by around 630,i took a bath,ate dinner and left for my usual night shift training schedule...i slept for an hour and after our 2am meal...my eyes were dropping...obviously i could not concentrate anymore and im drifting off to sleep already...like right now...my energy is sooo gone....:(
because of that stupid coffee i had last night...i only slept for 2 hrs. max...im just hoping i wont get sleepy later or have a headache... =(

so no work tonight...yippy! how am i doing?with life,i mean.i really don't know.right now,i just want to live each day.i just want to go with the flow.im so uncertain with my future right now.i don't want to make any final decisions yet.yup,i've set my goals but right now i don't want to pressure myself into doing everything to achieve it. i want to be free.in what sense?i really don't know.hey,i dont want to be a bum or anything like that.i just want to live each day as it passes.sometimes,i wish time would stop.i feel like everything around me happens so fast.everyone seems to be in a hurry...they go by so fast that everything looks blurry to me.ha!if only i could just shout:"hey everyone!take a break!" or if i had a magic spell to stop time.then things could be different...i guess so

i really don't understand this week...i mean...yup!like it was four days that i didn't make a lot of calls coz the system is soooo down and they are fixing it...we do report for work...but...we're not that productive...and probably on monday we won't have work also coz its memorial day in the US so we might not have work..."might"...hope so.... weekend plans...watch southborder again at dish,saturday night...and sunday morning swimming with froi and ina. in the afternoon we will meet with victoria...our classmate in high school whom we havent seen in like more than 10 years now.she'll meet us tomorrow together with her 2 yr. old baby boy....

since friday last week...systems were down...as early as 11pm we were instructed to log out and don't accept calls anymore...ok...so basically its like we're reporting to work but...but we are not doing anything and we still get paid!...well maybe discussing and brainstorming with teammates...that's all...kinda cool but hey,its making me sleepy most of the time...and i do manage to get some naps also..hehe!! had a really,really good time last sunday,during the company anniversary...it was held in ratsky's (morato),afterwards we went to music 21...for videoke...then to whistle stop for breakfast...went home by 5am (monday)...enjoyed it a lot!
this week seemed to start out good,even if last night i only had two sales...its ok...but one thing im sure of...my stats for this week is gonna be good...thank GOD!!!

as of now, the stats for our calls yesterday are not yet out ...but im kinda excited coz i made 6 sales...yup!its kind of a small step to most of my teammates...but to me...it means a lot already...i can't wait to see my stats... from 8-11pm i was just listening to calls...well,its a strategy...so that my stats would go up also...good for me...even though i was really excited to take calls tonight...well!just have to follow supervisor's orders....:D

downtime again...and this time as early as 11pm we had to stop taking calls again coz of this very bad network lines...its now 350am....boring...boring.... hope i'll have a good weekend...we might watch paolo santos tonight...that depends if my cousin and bro will go with me...hope so.... as early as now...i have a lot of weekend activities lined up already...like next saturday and sunday i'll be going out with my teammates for maybe a movie or dinner(saturday) and the company anniversary (sunday) which will be at ratzky's morato...im also planning to go to puerto galera and corregidor... whoa!the summer is nearly over and i don't even have a tan yet!!!sigh!i don't look so "summery" at all.:(

the lines are down tonight...it started around 12mn...its now 415am and we are just here...waiting...i doubt,we'll still accept calls...45 more minutes and we're going home already...so we are just here...talking...surfing...sleeping...might as well do some writing now.... latest news with my teachers' board application...the birth certificate that was issued to me had my original name...its not chona mae but bebel!!!i was so angry that i felt like all the blood was rising to my head and giving me the red face...i was shaking all over and tried to call mommy about it...yah!and i can hear myself almost shouting to hear coz with all the hassles that this examination is giving me...i haven't had my sleep yet coz after my shift i immediately went straight to prc...and so mom told me to just forego the exam...so i told her that i would just reimburse the exam fee...and when i went to the cashier...they won't honor the receipt anymore coz reimbursement can only be given 24 hours from original payment date...and the cashier told me i could get it but it would take a lot longer and i would have to write their officer or something...i was already fuming mad and i just decided to leave...to hell with them!!!...and as always,i was almost going to break out into tears again but i controlled myself...i was really fighting back the tears...my plan now is to try to ask for ina's help...if she can still help me out with my birth certificate then i'll go on...if not...maybe it is meant to be....i still have two weeks before the deadline to submit my papers....hope so
